intro: Hapalochilus trachyglossus, commonly known as the slender-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers with pale green centers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. Hapalochilus trachyglossus is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
